resourceTypeDtos.label: Rules of procedure
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé conformément au traité: «La Cour de justice établit son règlement de procédure. Ce règlement est soumis à l’approbation du Conseil.»

resourceTypeDtos.label: Addendum
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used when, for example, ‘Addendum to (provisional) list of ‘A’ items’ indicates that the new items are added to the agenda/‘A’ items list.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Letter of amendment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Letter sent by the Commission to propose amendments to the draft EU budget.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft delegated decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Article 290 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union allows the legislator to delegate to the Commission the power to adopt non-legislative acts of general application to supplement or amend certain non-essential elements of a legislative act (quasi-legislative acts).2) TFEU Art. 290 refers to delegated

resourceTypeDtos.label: Other acts
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Other acts shall be adopted on the basis of a Commission proposal where the Treaties so provide. This concept is used for publication in the Official Journal L, section L III and in the Official Journal C, section V (e).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Announcements
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for publication in the Official Journal C, section C V.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Archive file
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ensemble des documents réunis pour la conduite ou le traitement d’une affaire par une personne physique ou morale dans l’exercice de ses activités. Le dossier est ordinairement l’unité de base à l’intérieur d’une série organique.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Communication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The

resourceTypeDtos.label: Common position
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Position adopted by the Council in the context of the co-decision procedure (Article 251 TEC), where the Council did not approve all the European Parliament’s amendments to a legislative proposal; or position adopted by the Council in the context of the cooperation procedure (Article 252 TEC). Following the entry into force of the Treaty of Lisbon, replaced in the ordinary legislative procedure by ‘position at first reading’, in this case the code to be used is

resourceTypeDtos.label: Consolidated text
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Consolidation consists of the integration in a legal act of its successive amendments.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Corrigendum
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Term used in English, in the context of EU legislation, for corrections made to a text after its adoption.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: To exercise the Union’s competences, the institutions adopt regulations, directives, decisions, recommendations and opinions.A decision is binding in its entirety. A decision which specifies those to whom it is addressed is binding only on them.Decisions are published in the Official Journal L, section L I (c) and section (d).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Acts adopted under

resourceTypeDtos.label: Decision by national courts in the field of European Union law
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Decision made by national courts in the field of European Union law.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Impact assessment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Before the European Commission proposes a new initiative, it evaluates the potential economic, social and environmental consequences. An impact assessment gives decision-makers evidence regarding the need for EU action and the advantages and disadvantages of alternative policy choices. It may also find that no action should be taken at EU level. Impact assessments are currently published on EUR-Lex, but not for delegated, implementing or RPS (regulatory procedure with scrutiny) acts.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Information
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour désigner les informations sur les décisions non publiées.

resourceTypeDtos.label: National transposition measures
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Mesures prises par les États membres pour transposer une directive de l’Union européenne dans le droit national.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The Official Journal of the European Union is the authoritative source of EU law and it is published every day from Tuesday to Saturday in the official EU languages. There are 2 series: L (legislation) and C (information and notices). Subseries CA, with the same number as the C series published on the same day, contains calls for expressions of interest, vacancy notices, etc. The subseries I (LI and CI) was introduced on 1 January 2016. This allows for greater flexibility in the event of a change in the planned content of the Official Journal. Effective 1 July 2013, the electronic edition of the OJ is authentic and produces legal effects.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion on the European Parliament’s amendments
Own-initiative report
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Report adopted without being requested to do so by an EU institution.

resourceTypeDtos.label: General publications
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Non-legal publications used for promotion, information and reference purposes.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Implementing regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Les États membres prennent toutes les mesures de droit interne nécessaires pour la mise en œuvre des actes juridiquement contraignants de l’Union. Lorsque des conditions uniformes d’exécution des actes juridiquement contraignants de l’Union sont nécessaires, ces actes confèrent des compétences d’exécution à la Commission ou, dans des cas spécifiques dûment justifiés et dans les cas prévus aux articles 24 et 26 du traité sur l’Union européenne, au Conseil.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Study
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A study is a document resulting from intellectual services necessary to support the institution

resourceTypeDtos.label: Contents
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Liste des titres et des sous-titres des parties d’un document, dans l’ordre dans lequel elles se présentent avec indication des pages ou des colonnes où ces parties commencent.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Pour exercer les compétences de l’Union, les institutions adoptent des règlements, des directives, des décisions, des recommandations et des avis. Le règlement a une portée générale. Il est obligatoire dans tous ses éléments et il est directement applicable dans tout État membre. Les règlements sont publiés au Journal officiel L, section L I (a) et section L II (b).

resourceTypeDtos.label: International agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The concept

resourceTypeDtos.label: Exchange of letters
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Method whereby states express their consent to be bound by exchanging signed letters.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Exchange rate
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ratio at which the principal unit of two currencies may be traded, whether arbitrarily established by government action or based on the relative capacity of each currency to buy on a free market.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Information
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for describing section II in OJ C; it is usually in the plural form.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Summaries of EU legislation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A text of +/- 3500 characters, summarising main aspects of a specific law or a legal aspect of a specific EU policy.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Information note
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Council document containing a text coming from the Council but also another document coming from another author (EU or Member States).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for secondary legislation and for preparatory acts.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Recommendation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Pour exercer les compétences de l’Union, les institutions adoptent des règlements, des directives, des décisions, des recommandations et des avis.Les recommandations et les avis ne lient pas.Les recommandations sont publiées au Journal officiel L, section L II (e), et au Journal officiel C, section C I. Les avis sont publiés dans la section C I.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: To exercise the Union’s competences, the institutions adopt regulations, directives, decisions, recommendations and opinions.A directive is binding, as to the result to be achieved, upon each Member State to which it is addressed, but leaves to the national authorities the choice of form and methods.Directives are published in the Official Journal L, section L I (b) and section L II (c).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Own-initiative resolution
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Resolution adopted without being requested to do so by an EU institution.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Proposal for a decision without addressee
Recruitment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for documents usually published in OJ C (a) under the administrative announcements part.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Communication concerning the position of the Council
Legislative resolution
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A legislative resolution is European Parliament’s position on a given draft legislative act.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Signature file for the authentic Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A digital signature in the Commission model is a standalone signature file related to (typically) one OJ, special edition of the OJ or Court of Justice report with all its expressions and PDF manifestations (full and TOC) as well as all its acts. It is a plain vanilla work with the only special relationship

resourceTypeDtos.label: Internal agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé dans les types de documents d’EUR-Lex, secteur 3Q.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Implementing decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Member States adopt all measures of national law necessary to implement legally binding Union acts.Where uniform conditions for implementing legally binding Union acts are needed, those acts confer implementing powers on the Commission, or, in duly justified specific cases and in the cases provided for in Articles 24 and 26 of the Treaty on European Union, on the Council.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint action
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Legal instrument under Title V of the Treaty on European Union (common foreign and security policy (CFSP)).The Treaty of Lisbon amended Articles 12 and 14 TEU, replacing joint actions by Council decisions.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Conclusions
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Conclusions reached by Councils in different configurations.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint staff working document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Staff working documents are factual and informative documents, transmitted by the European Commission to one or more of the other European Union institutions, that do not have any legal effect and do not require approval by the College of Commissioners. ‘Joint’ means that the document is presented by the Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy together.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Own-initiative opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Opinion adopted without being requested to do so by an EU institution.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Staff working document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Factual and informative document, transmitted by the European Commission to one or more of the other European Union institutions, that does not have any legal effect and does not require approval by the College of Commissioners.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Preparatory act
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour la publication au Journal officiel C, section C III, et dans les types de documents d’EUR-Lex, secteur 5.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Budget
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for publication in the Official Journal L, section L I (d) and is used in the types of documents of EUR-Lex, sector 5 BP.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Award notice
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Notice of the results of an award procedure, to be issued by contracting authorities which have awarded a public contract or concluded a framework agreement.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Contract notice
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Individual notice whereby contracting authorities make known their intention to award a particular public contract or framework agreement and which includes essential information on the public contract or framework agreement.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Rules of procedure
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used in accordance with Article 15(3) TFEU: ‘Each institution, body, office or agency shall ensure that its proceedings are transparent and shall elaborate in its own Rules of Procedure specific provisions regarding access to its documents, in accordance with the regulations referred to in the second subparagraph.’

resourceTypeDtos.label: Summary of impact assessment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Document that should: (a) present a summary of the problem description and the objectives; (b) present the analysis of subsidiarity; (c) list the range of options identified and the options assessed in detail; (d) present the main economic, social and environmental impacts of each option and, where relevant; (e) the result of the comparison of the options, indicating the criteria for comparison.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Legislative acts
resourceTypeDtos.definition: EU legal act adopted by legislative procedure (Article 289(3) TFEU). As mentioned in Article 289(2) TFUE, it can be adopted either by the ordinary legislative procedure (defined in Article 294 TFEU) or a special legislative procedure. Legislative acts are published in section L I of the Official Journal.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Declaration
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Act under international law, which may or may not be legally binding, in which a state or states note the existence of a situation that is recognised and accepted by the international community, or seek its recognition or acceptance.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Guideline
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Orientations de la BCE publiées au Journal officiel, section L II (f).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Cover note
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Document du Conseil contenant seulement un document élaboré par un autre auteur (institutions de l’UE ou des États membres, organes et agences). Par conséquent, ce type de document peut être multilingue.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Notification
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used in the domain of competition and published in OJ C with a specific identifier which is not a Celex number (e.g. C2014/021/07). This should not be confused with notification made by a third party, for example a Member State (preparatory or secondary legislation) published in OJ L or in OJ C.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Acts adopted under

resourceTypeDtos.label: Delegated decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Un acte législatif peut déléguer à la Commission le pouvoir d’adopter des actes non législatifs de portée générale qui complètent ou modifient certains éléments non essentiels de l’acte législatif.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Memorandum of understanding
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Less formal international instrument than a typical treaty or international agreement, often used to set out operational arrangements under a framework international agreement, or to specify technical or detailed matters.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Annual report with the statement of assurance
Roadmap
resourceTypeDtos.definition: In so-called Roadmaps [a generic term covering several specific templates], the European Commission informs stakeholders and citizens about new initiatives. The standard Roadmap template is used for new major initiatives without impact assessment. They describe the problem to be tackled and the objectives to be achieved, justify the need for EU action and its added value and outline alternative policy options, while also explaining why a formal impact assessment is not necessary.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Act
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce terme est utilisé pour décrire le concept général d’un acte; la formule au singulier est d’application. Les actes législatifs et les actes non législatifs sont décrits séparément.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Judgment (extracts)
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour les arrêts faisant l’objet d’une publication par extraits au Recueil.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint proposal for a decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Proposal for a decision adopted jointly by the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy and the Commission.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint proposal for a regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Proposal for a regulation adopted jointly by the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy and the Commission.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Specific annual report
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This term is used to define the European Court of Auditors Specific Annual Reports (around 50) on the annual financial audits of the EU’s agencies, joint undertakings and other decentralised bodies.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Model notice for public procurement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Notice models used as a template by contracting authorities for sending public procurement notices.

resourceTypeDtos.label: White Paper
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Commission White Papers are documents containing proposals for EU action in a specific area. In some cases they follow a Green Paper published to launch a consultation process at European level. When a White Paper is favourably received by the Council, it can lead to an action programme for the Union in the area concerned.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Delegated regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A legislative act may delegate to the Commission the power to adopt non-legislative acts of general application to supplement or amend certain non-essential elements of the legislative act.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Exploratory opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Opinion in which the European Economic and Social Committee, at the request of a European institution, reflects and makes suggestions on a given subject.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Framework decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Framework decisions were used to approximate (align) the laws and regulations of the Member States. Proposals are made on the initiative of the Commission or a Member State and they have to be adopted unanimously. They are binding on the Member States as to the result to be achieved but leave the choice of form and methods to the national authorities.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Special report
resourceTypeDtos.definition: In case of the European Court of Auditors, this term is used to define its Special Reports (SRs) setting out the results of selected performance and compliance audits of specific budgetary areas or management topics. The ECA produces around 20 SRs each year.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Position
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This code has to be used for the Council

resourceTypeDtos.label: Green Paper
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Green Papers are documents published by the European Commission to stimulate discussion on given topics at European level. They invite the relevant parties (bodies or individuals) to participate in a consultation process and debate on the basis of the proposals they put forward. Green Papers may give rise to legislative developments that are then outlined in White Papers.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Executive summary of an evaluation study
Opinion on impact assessment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Assessment of the quality of draft impact assessment. It contains recommendations on how the draft report should be improved by the Commission services.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Implementing directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Member States shall adopt all measures of national law necessary to implement legally binding Union acts.Where uniform conditions for implementing legally binding Union acts are needed, those acts shall confer implementing powers on the Commission, or, in duly justified specific cases and in the cases provided for in Articles 24 and 26 of the Treaty on European Union, on the Council.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Administrative procedures
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for describing the section V (a) in OJ C; it is usually in the plural form.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Delegated directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Un acte législatif peut déléguer à la Commission le pouvoir d

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft implementing regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Measures that implement provisions of the basic legal act, which are referred to as

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft delegated directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Article 290 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union allows the legislator to delegate to the Commission the power to adopt non-legislative acts of general application to supplement or amend certain non-essential elements of a legislative act (quasi-legislative acts).2) TFEU Art. 290 refers to delegated

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Acts adopted under

resourceTypeDtos.label: Statement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Chacun des membres du Conseil et la Commission peuvent exprimer leur opinion à l’occasion de l’approbation des points «A» de l’ordre du jour provisoire du Conseil et faire inscrire des déclarations au procès-verbal. Les déclarations sont rendus publiques.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Statement of reasons
resourceTypeDtos.definition: L’exposé des motifs est le document qui accompagne la position du Conseil en première lecture et par lequel le Conseil informe pleinement le Parlement des raisons qui l’ont amené à s’écarter de la position de ce dernier et qui l’ont conduit à adopter sa propre position en première lecture. La version finale de l’exposé des motifs est publiée au Journal officiel C, section C III.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Attachment order
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A legal device through which a tax collector may obtain an order permitting the collection of tax from assets or income of the defaulter other than on the assets or income upon which the tax is based.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Proposal for an opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is meant to be used for the proposal made by the Commission pursuant to Article 9(4) of Regulation (EU) No 473/2013 (OJ L 140, 27.5.2013, p. 20).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Financial regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Regulation which lays down the rules applicable to the establishment and implementation of the general budget of the European Communities, currently Regulation (EU, Euratom) No 966/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the financial rules applicable to the general budget of the Union (CELEX: 32012R0966).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft implementing decision
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Measures that implement provisions of the basic legal act, which are referred to as

resourceTypeDtos.label: Inception impact assessment
resourceTypeDtos.definition: If an impact assessment is planned for an initiative, the standard Roadmap is replaced by an inception impact assessment (template), which sets out in greater detail the description of the problem, issues related to subsidiarity, the policy objectives and options as well as the likely impacts of each option. All initiatives likely to have significant economic, environmental or social impacts should undergo impact assessment.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft delegated regulation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Article 290 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union allows the legislator to delegate to the Commission the power to adopt non-legislative acts of general application to supplement or amend certain non-essential elements of a legislative act (quasi-legislative acts).2) TFEU Art. 290 refers to delegated

resourceTypeDtos.label: Interest rate — euro exchange rates
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Interest rate applied by the European Central Bank to its main refinancing operations (MRO).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Interinstitutional agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour la publication au Journal officiel C, section C II (a).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft implementing directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) Measures that implement provisions of the basic legal act, which are referred to as

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion of the Court
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Un État membre, le Parlement européen, le Conseil ou la Commission peuvent recueillir l’avis de la Cour de justice sur la compatibilité d’un accord envisagé avec les traités. En cas d’avis négatif de la Cour, l’accord envisagé ne peut entrer en vigueur, sauf modification de celui-ci ou révision des traités.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Evaluation roadmap
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The evaluation roadmap outlines 1) the context of the evaluation briefly describing the expected role and original objectives of the EU intervention(s) being evaluated. It also explains why the intervention(s) is (are) being evaluated (e.g. legal requirement); 2) the purpose and scope of the evaluation, explaining what the evaluation will deliver and how its results will be used. The scope should set out clearly what actions, time period and geographical area will be covered by the evaluation and what will not (with any associated justification for excluding e.g. certain articles, covering only a shorter period or not all EU Member States).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft statement of reasons
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Le projet d’exposé des motifs est la version du document soumis pour approbation au Conseil.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Amendments to the proposal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The adoption of amendments by the European Parliament (EP) represents only a step in the procedure (i.e. the legislative procedure is not finalised yet and the legislative resolution has not been put to the vote at the EP Plenary session). So the amendments do not represent the final position of EP. When the dossier comes back to the Plenary session, accompanied (or not) by new amendments, the legislative resolution will be voted and the EP

resourceTypeDtos.label: Common strategy
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An instrument of the common foreign and security policy introduced by the Treaty of Amsterdam. The Treaty of Lisbon amended Articles 12 and 13 TEU, removing all references to common strategies.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint text
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The code/concept

resourceTypeDtos.label: Guideline
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A document providing guidance, advice, or explanation to functional area specialists, in particular for the Commission, in the field of health.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Annual report on the activities funded by the European Development Fund
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This term is used to define the European Court of Auditors Annual Reports on the European Development Funds. The ECA Annual Reports mainly comprise the annual statements of assurance but also cover performance issues. They are published in November each year.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Acknowledgement receipt
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour prendre acte de la communication d’un texte.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Order (extracts)
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour les ordonnances faisant l’objet d’une publication par extraits au Recueil.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Annual report on the EU general budget
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This term is used to define the European Court of Auditors Annual Reports on the EU general budget. The ECA Annual Reports mainly comprise the annual statements of assurance but also cover performance issues. They are published in November each year.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Acts adopted by bodies created by international agreements
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ce concept est utilisé pour la publication au Journal officiel L, section L II (h), et dans les types de documents d’EUR-Lex, secteur 2D.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Non-legislative acts
resourceTypeDtos.definition: EU legal act which is not a legislative act for not being adopted by legislative procedure (by a reading a contrario of the Article 289(3) TFEU). Non-legislative acts include inter alia delegated acts (Article 290 TFEU) and implementing acts (Article 291 TFEU). They are published in section L II of the Official Journal.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Texts adopted
resourceTypeDtos.definition: [For legislative proposals:] The text of the proposal as approved by Parliament and the accompanying resolution shall be forwarded to the Council and the Commission by the President as Parliament

resourceTypeDtos.label: Additional agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used for a ‘codicil’ that is usually a supplement of addition to a will. It is rarely used in other contexts.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Agreement between Member States
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The concept

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft agreement between Member States
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Le concept

resourceTypeDtos.label: Draft international agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Le concept

resourceTypeDtos.label: Citizens’ summary
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Citizens’ summaries are short, straightforward summaries of major policy initiatives designed for people not familiar with the EU.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Confirmation of the rejection of the common position
Request form for the table of contents of the Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: OJ TOC form is used to inform the Publications Office about the current status (list of documents, pagination, etc.) of a given OJ.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for pre-press of publication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Request for the publication of a single document. It is used both for daily and extra OJs. A pre-press request concerns a single document. This means that it may contain one or more TOC entries.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for publication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Request form for the publication of an extra OJ.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for the acceptance of publication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Acceptance form used to inform the Publications Office about the acceptance to publish an extra OJ.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for the refusal of publication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Refusal form used to inform the Publications Office about the refusal to publish an extra OJ.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for the ready-for-press of publication
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Ready-for-press request is sent to confirm the publication and the print run of a given OJ (extra and daily).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Glossary term
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A term that is often used in the summaries.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Supplementary information
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Supplementary information (e.g. table, corrected image, corrected manuscript, etc.). In the context of the Official Journal publication, this concept is used for the production of the final document.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Introductory text
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A short text that explains a specific topic under which certain summaries are grouped on EUR-Lex.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint proposal for a directive
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Proposal for a directive adopted jointly by the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy and the Commission.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Special edition of the Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: L’édition spéciale du Journal officiel contient le droit dérivé en vigueur à la date d’adhésion de l’État membre concerné.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Petition
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The right of petition is the right of any citizen of the Union, and any natural or legal person residing or having its registered office in a Member State, to submit a request or complaint to the European Parliament on a matter which comes within the Union’s fields of activity and which affects him, her or it directly (Article 227 TFEU).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Planning document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Document containing a list of all upcoming delegated and implementing acts and RPS (regulatory procedure with scrutiny) measures submitted for public feedback.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Confirmation of the rejection of the position
Contents of the special edition of the Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A listing of the parts of a special edition of the Official Journal in the order they are presented.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Warning
resourceTypeDtos.definition: 1) When significant risks to the achievement of the objective in Article 3(1) of the Regulation (EU) No 1092/2010 are identified, the European Systemic Risk Board (ESRB) shall provide warnings and, where appropriate, issue recommendations for remedial action, including, where appropriate, for legislative initiatives.2) Warnings or recommendations issued by the ESRB in accordance with Article 3(2)(c) and (d) may be of either a general or a specific nature and shall be addressed in particular to the Union as a whole or to one or more Member States, or to one or more of the European Supervisory Authorities (ESAs), or to one or more of the national supervisory authorities.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Webpage
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A single page resource available from the World Wide Web.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Website
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A collection of related web resources, grouped by common elements in the URL (web address).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Work bundle
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Compilation of works, possibly by different persons, or corporate bodies, treated for some purpose as a single work. A WORK_BUNDLE should have one or more collective titles. The individual works contained in this WORK_BUNDLE can, but do not have to, also exist as individual works

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint implementation plan
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Implementation plan jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Synopsis report of the public consultation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The synopsis report summarises the results of all the consultation activities in relation to a particular initiative, and gives a qualitative analytical overview of these results. Its aim is twofold: to inform policymaking on the outcome of all consultation activities; to inform stakeholders on how their input has been taken into account and to explain why certain suggestions could not be taken up.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Evaluation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Evaluation is a process that gathers evidence to provide an objective judgement of the performance of existing EU policies, legislation and spending programmes (EU interventions or EU activities).

resourceTypeDtos.label: Fitness check
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A fitness check is a comprehensive evaluation of a policy area that usually addresses how several related legislative acts have contributed (or otherwise) to the attainment of policy objectives. Fitness checks are particularly well-suited to identify overlaps, inconsistencies synergies and the cumulative impacts of regulation. Their findings serve as a basis for deciding whether the regulation in place for a given sector needs to be adapted in future.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Implementation plan
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The implementation plan aims at facilitating the timely and effective application of law by the Member States. It should list the various actions which are needed to implement the legislative act and identify the main implementation challenges.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Stakeholder feedback
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Stakeholder feedback received on a legislative proposal.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint evaluation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Evaluation jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Executive summary of the joint evaluation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Executive summary of an evaluation jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Executive summary of the evaluation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Executive summary of an evaluation.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Executive summary of the fitness check
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Executive summary of a fitness check.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint synopsis report of the public consultation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Synopsis report for Commission initiatives without impact assessment or evaluation jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Factual summary report of the public consultation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Factual information on the input received from stakeholders during a specific consultation activity.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Executive summary of the joint fitness check
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Executive summary of a fitness check jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Consultation strategy
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The purpose of the consultation strategy is to design an effective and efficient consultation approach for a Commission initiative. The consultation strategy should cover the following key elements: consultation scope and objectives, identification of stakeholders, envisaged consultation activities, their timing and language regime.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint fitness check
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Fitness check jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint stakeholder feedback
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Stakeholder feedback received on a legislative proposal jointly prepared by the European Commission and the High Representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs and Security.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Motion for a resolution
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A draft resolution tabled by a committee, a political group or a minimum number of Members as defined in the European Parliament’s Rules of Procedure. It includes proposals for certain decisions tabled by the Conference of Presidents.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Joint motion for a resolution
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A draft resolution tabled jointly by different authors, as defined in the European Parliament’s Rules of Procedure.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Reasoned opinion of national Parliament
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Opinion sent by a national Parliament to Presidents of the European Parliament, the Council and the Commission, stating why it considers that a draft legislative act does not comply with the principle of subsidiarity.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Provisional opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of the European Economic and Social Committee (EESC) opinion as approved by the competent Section of the EESC (internally named

resourceTypeDtos.label: Adopted exploratory opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of an exploratory opinion as adopted by the European Economic and Social Committee (EESC) at the Plenary Session (having the acronym

resourceTypeDtos.label: Provisional exploratory opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of an exploratory opinion as approved by the competent Section of the European Economic and Social Committee (internally named

resourceTypeDtos.label: Voting result
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Information note in all official EU languages setting out the voting results on a legislative act adopted at a Council meeting.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Adopted opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of an opinion as adopted by the EESC at the Plenary Session (having the acronym

resourceTypeDtos.label: Archived website
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An archived website is the result of web archiving (harvesting with a web crawler), the process of creating an archival copy of a website. An archived website is a snapshot of how an original website looked at a particular point in time. It contains as much as possible from the original website, including text, images, audio, videos, and PDF files but due to web archiving limitations certain parts of the original website might not exist in the archived website.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Adopted acts
resourceTypeDtos.definition: This concept is used in the context of Commission internal procedures leading to the adoption of delegated/implementing/PRAC acts. The act adopted by the Commission is sent to EP and Council and if during the so-called objection period (usually 2 months) none of the institutions raised any objections, the adopted act is published in the Official Journal of the EU and becomes legally binding.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Adopted own-initiative opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of an own-initiative opinion as adopted by the European Economic and Social Committee at the Plenary Session (having the acronym

resourceTypeDtos.label: Provisional own-initiative opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: It is the version of an own-initiative opinion as approved by the competent Section of the European Economic and Social Committee (internally named

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion on draft national legislation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Opinion delivered by the European Central Bank (ECB) concerning the draft national legislation. EU Member States need to ensure that the ECB is consulted at an appropriate stage enabling the authority initiating the draft legislative provision to take into consideration the ECB’s opinion before taking its decision on the substance.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Proposal for a legislative act
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Proposal for an act to be adopted by a legislative procedure and thus to become a legislative act.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Withdrawal agreement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Accord négocié et conclu entre l’Union européenne et un État membre qui a décidé de se retirer de l’Union, fixant les modalités de retrait de l’État en question en tenant compte du cadre de ses relations futures avec l’Union.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion on evaluation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Assessment of the quality of a draft major evaluation report. It contains recommendations on how the draft report should be improved by the Commission services.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Explanatory memorandum
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Document which accompanies all Commission proposals submitted to the Council or to the European Parliament and the Council. It explains the context, justifications and foreseen impact of the Commission

resourceTypeDtos.label: Contributions to the consultation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Contributions received during a public consultation.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Documents annexed to contributions
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Documents annexed to contributions received during a public consultation.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Background document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Background document related to a public consultation.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Opinion on fitness check
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Assessment of the quality of a draft fitness check report. It contains recommendations on how the draft report should be improved by the Commission services.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for communication post about a document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Request form for communication post about a document is used to exchange some supplementary information with the contractor concerning a document. The Publications Office or the contractor can initiate this exchange.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request form for communication post about Official Journal
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Request form for communication post about Official Journal (OJ) is used to exchange some supplementary information with the contractor concerning an OJ. The Publications Office or the contractor can initiate this exchange.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Technical working document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Technical working document contains drafting proposals produced in connection with an ECB opinion.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Commission work programme
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The Commission work programme shows how the Commission plans to give practical effect to the political priorities set out by the President. It provides a multiannual overview to help stakeholders and the other EU institutions plan their work with the Commission.

resourceTypeDtos.label: News announcement
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A news announcement is a brief published text summarising and drawing attention to developments and initiatives with recent or immediate temporal relevance.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Progress report
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A progress report provides updates on the Commission

resourceTypeDtos.label: Notice to stakeholders
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A notice to stakeholders aims at preparing citizens and stakeholders for major developments, such as the withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union, and sets out the consequences in a range of policy areas.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Strategic plan
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Strategic plans are planning documents where departments describe how they will contribute to the Commission

resourceTypeDtos.label: Delegated act
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A delegated act is a legally binding act that enables the Commission to supplement or amend non‑essential parts of EU legislative acts, for example, in order to define detailed measures.

resourceTypeDtos.label: News article
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A news article is an article whose content reports news or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Schedule
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A schedule is a list of planned activities or things to be done showing the times or dates when they are intended to happen or be done. Examples include schedules of upcoming events and published agendas of public figures.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Management plan
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Management plans outline department activities for the year ahead and how they contribute to meeting the objectives set in their strategic plan. Every department of the European Commission has a management plan for the year to come.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Presentation
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A presentation is a slide deck illustrating bits of information in support of a formal talk.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Recommendation adopted by bodies created by international agreements
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The recommendation adopted by bodies created by international agreements is a type of document used in the public international law context.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Regulation adopted by bodies created by international agreements
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The regulation adopted by bodies created by international agreements is a type of document used in the public international law context.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Decision adopted by bodies created by international agreements
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The decision adopted by bodies created by international agreements is a type of document used in the public international law context.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Questionnaire
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A questionnaire is a set questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Forecast
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A forecast is a document presenting informed estimates that are predictive in determining the direction of future trends.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Scientific paper
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A scientific paper refers to contributions to periodicals, conferences or book chapters written on a specific scientific subject.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Member state information exchange
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Member state information exchange refers to information exchanged between European institutions and bodies and EU Member States and EFTA countries in relation to a specific topic.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Action document
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An action document is a document detailing support for a certain activity or sector and providing details of objectives, allocated budget, expected outcome etc.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Department work programme
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A department work programme is an annual or multiannual planning document explaining how the budget allocated for certain policies or funding programmes will be spent by a department of the European Commission.

resourceTypeDtos.label: National plan
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A national plan describes measures a government has initiated in order to achieve national targets and how country-specific recommendations given by the EU have been taken into consideration.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Annual management and performance report
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An annual management and performance report produced by the Commission provides an overview of the results achieved by the EU budget and explains how it was managed and protected.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Agenda
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An agenda is a list of items to be discussed at a formal meeting.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Factsheet
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A factsheet refers to a presentation of data showing the most important or relevant facts in a simple, easy-to-read manner. This concept also covers presentation of data in dynamic or interactive infographic formats.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Expert opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: An expert opinion is advice provided by an independent panel of experts on a particular subject.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Procurement notice
resourceTypeDtos.definition: The procurement notice is a type of document that is used in the public procurement context.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Own-initiative opinion on draft national legislation
Newsletter
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A newsletter is a publication with information about the recent activities of an organisation, sent regularly to its members or stakeholders.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Guidance note
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A guidance note is a publication aiming to answer certain questions that have been brought to the Commission’s attention providing guidance on the application of certain provisions.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Speech
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A speech is a published summary or transcript of a formal address or discourse delivered to an audience.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Magazine
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A magazine refers to a periodical publication, on a tangible medium or in an electronic format, containing articles and illustrations, typically covering a particular subject or area of interest.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Promotional material
resourceTypeDtos.definition: Promotional material refers to a publication containing descriptive or public awareness raising material formatted for both online and print distribution, e.g. brochures, leaflets and posters.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Budgetary discharge
resourceTypeDtos.definition: When the European Parliament decides to grant the discharge to the way the Commission has implemented the EU budget in a given year, it leads to the formal closure of the accounts of the institution for that year.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Glossary
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A glossary refers to a list of terms in a special subject, field or area of usage, with accompanying definitions.

resourceTypeDtos.label: Request for an opinion
resourceTypeDtos.definition: A request for an opinion is a request for advice (mandate) made by the European Commission to an independent group of experts.
